##### Expressive

:::

Turing models are easy to write and communicate, with syntax that is close to the mathematical specification of the model.

:::

##### General-purpose

:::

Turing supports models with discrete parameters and stochastic control flow.

:::

::: {#tab-model .code-content .active}
```{.julia .code-overflow-scroll}
using Turing

@model function linear_regression(x)
    # Priors
    α ~ Normal(0, 1)
    β ~ Normal(0, 1)
    σ² ~ truncated(Cauchy(0, 3); lower=0)

    # Likelihood
    μ = α .+ β .* x
    y ~ MvNormal(μ, σ² * I)
end
```
:::

::: {#tab-condition .code-content}
```julia
# Data
x_data = rand(10)
y_data = rand(10)

# Condition model on data
model = linear_regression(x_data) | (; y = y_data)
```
:::

::: {#tab-prior .code-content}
```julia
# Sample from the prior
prior = sample(model, Prior(), 100)
```
:::

::: {#tab-inference .code-content}
```julia
# Run inference using NUTS
chain = sample(model, NUTS(), 1000)
```
:::

::: {#tab-analysis .code-content}
```julia
# Analyze the posterior
describe(chain)
plot(chain)
```
:::

:::

    \gamma &\sim \mathcal{N}(0, \sqrt{10}) \\
    \beta &\sim \mathcal{N}(0, I) \\
    y_i &\sim \log \mathcal{N}(\beta \cdot x_i + \gamma, \sigma)
\end{align*}
$$

linear_regression.jl
:::
::: {.node-body}
```julia
@model function linear_regression(x)
    d = size(x, 1)
    
    # Priors
    σ² ~ InverseGamma(3, 4 / 10)
    γ ~ Normal(0, √10)
    β ~ MvNormal(zeros(d), I)
    
    # Likelihood
    y ~ MvLogNormal(x' * β .+ γ, σ² * I) 
end

model = linear_regression(x_data)
```

```{=html}
<script>
  // Tab Switching Logic
  function switchTab(event, tabId) {
    // Remove active class from all tabs
    const tabs = event.target.parentElement.querySelectorAll('.tab');
    tabs.forEach(tab => tab.classList.remove('active'));
    
    // Add active class to clicked tab
    event.target.classList.add('active');
    
    // Hide all content
    const container = event.target.closest('.code-window');
    const contents = container.querySelectorAll('.code-content');
    contents.forEach(content => content.classList.remove('active'));
    
    // Show selected content
    const selectedContent = container.querySelector(`#${tabId}`);
    if (selectedContent) {
      selectedContent.classList.add('active');
    }
  }

  /**
   * Lightweight Flowchart Connector
   * Draws SVG paths between elements without external dependencies.
   */
  class FlowConnector {
    constructor(containerId, svgId) {
      this.container = document.querySelector(containerId);
      this.svg = document.getElementById(svgId);
      this.paths = [];
      
      if (!this.container || !this.svg) return;

      // Bind methods
      this.draw = this.draw.bind(this);
      
      // Initial draw
      window.addEventListener('load', this.draw);
      window.addEventListener('resize', this.draw);
      
      // Wait for images to load
      const images = this.container.querySelectorAll('img');
      images.forEach(img => img.addEventListener('load', this.draw));
      
      // Initial delay to ensure layout is settled
      setTimeout(this.draw, 100);
      setTimeout(this.draw, 500);
    }

    getCoords(elem) {
      const box = elem.getBoundingClientRect();
      const containerBox = this.container.getBoundingClientRect();
      return {
        x: box.left - containerBox.left,
        y: box.top - containerBox.top,
        w: box.width,
        h: box.height,
        r: box.right - containerBox.left,
        b: box.bottom - containerBox.top,
        cx: box.left - containerBox.left + box.width / 2,
        cy: box.top - containerBox.top + box.height / 2
      };
    }

    createPath(id, isDashed = false) {
      let path = document.getElementById(id);
      if (!path) {
        path = document.createElementNS("http://www.w3.org/2000/svg", "path");
        path.id = id;
        path.setAttribute("class", "flow-arrow-path");
        path.setAttribute("marker-end", "url(#arrowhead)");
        if (isDashed) {
            path.style.strokeDasharray = "5,5";
        }
        this.svg.appendChild(path);
      }
      return path;
    }

    drawCurve(start, end, id, isDashed = false) {
      const path = this.createPath(id, isDashed);
      // Sigmoid Curve: Right of Start -> Left of End
      const sx = start.r;
      const sy = start.cy;
      const ex = end.x;
      const ey = end.cy;
      
      const dist = Math.abs(ex - sx);
      const cp1x = sx + dist * 0.5;
      const cp1y = sy;
      const cp2x = ex - dist * 0.5;
      const cp2y = ey;

      path.setAttribute("d", `M ${sx} ${sy} C ${cp1x} ${cp1y}, ${cp2x} ${cp2y}, ${ex} ${ey}`);
    }

    drawStraight(start, end, id) {
      const path = this.createPath(id);
      // Straight Line: Bottom of Start -> Top of End
      const sx = start.cx;
      const sy = start.b;
      const ex = end.cx;
      const ey = end.y;

      path.setAttribute("d", `M ${sx} ${sy} L ${ex} ${ey}`);
    }

    drawHorizontal(start, end, id) {
      const path = this.createPath(id);
      // Straight Line: Right of Start -> Left of End
      const sx = start.r;
      const sy = start.cy;
      const ex = end.x;
      const ey = end.cy;

      path.setAttribute("d", `M ${sx} ${sy} L ${ex} ${ey}`);
    }

    drawFeedback(start, end, id) {
        const path = this.createPath(id, true); // Dashed
        // Curve from Left of Start to Right of End (Backwards)
        const sx = start.x;
        const sy = start.cy;
        const ex = end.r;
        const ey = end.cy;
        
        // Control points to curve around
        const cp1x = sx - 50;
        const cp1y = sy;
        const cp2x = ex + 50;
        const cp2y = ey;
        
        // Or maybe a big C curve
        path.setAttribute("d", `M ${sx} ${sy} C ${sx - 100} ${sy}, ${ex + 100} ${ey}, ${ex} ${ey}`);
    }

    draw() {
      const nodes = {
        math: document.getElementById('node-math'),
        model: document.getElementById('node-model'),
        prior: document.getElementById('node-prior'),
        condition: document.getElementById('node-condition'),
        determinability: document.getElementById('node-determinability'),
        inference: document.getElementById('node-inference'),
        analysis: document.getElementById('node-analysis'),
        predictions: document.getElementById('node-predictions')
      };

      if (!nodes.model) return;

      const pos = {};
      for (const [key, el] of Object.entries(nodes)) {
        if(el) pos[key] = this.getCoords(el);
      }

      // Desktop Layout (> 992px)
      if (window.innerWidth > 992) {
        // 1. Math -> Model (Horizontal)
        if(pos.math && pos.model) this.drawHorizontal(pos.math, pos.model, 'path-math-model');
        
        // 2. Model -> Prior (Diagonal/Curve)
        if(pos.model && pos.prior) {
             const path = this.createPath('path-model-prior');
             path.setAttribute("d", `M ${pos.model.cx} ${pos.model.b} C ${pos.model.cx} ${pos.model.b + 50}, ${pos.prior.cx} ${pos.prior.y - 50}, ${pos.prior.cx} ${pos.prior.y}`);
        }

        // 3. Model -> Condition (Vertical)
        if(pos.model && pos.condition) this.drawStraight(pos.model, pos.condition, 'path-model-cond');

        // 4. Prior -> Determinability (Vertical)
        if(pos.prior && pos.determinability) this.drawStraight(pos.prior, pos.determinability, 'path-prior-det');

        // 5. Condition -> Inference (Vertical)
        if(pos.condition && pos.inference) this.drawStraight(pos.condition, pos.inference, 'path-cond-inf');

        // 6. Inference -> Analysis (Vertical)
        if(pos.inference && pos.analysis) this.drawStraight(pos.inference, pos.analysis, 'path-inf-ana');

        // 7. Analysis -> Predictions (Vertical)
        if(pos.analysis && pos.predictions) this.drawStraight(pos.analysis, pos.predictions, 'path-ana-pred');

        // 8. Predictions -> Determinability (Feedback)
        if(pos.predictions && pos.determinability) this.drawFeedback(pos.predictions, pos.determinability, 'path-feedback');
        
        // Ensure paths are visible
        this.svg.style.display = 'block';
      } else {
        // Mobile Layout: Linear Flow
        const order = ['math', 'model', 'prior', 'determinability', 'condition', 'inference', 'analysis', 'predictions'];
        for(let i=0; i < order.length - 1; i++) {
            const start = pos[order[i]];
            const end = pos[order[i+1]];
            if(start && end) this.drawStraight(start, end, `path-mobile-${i}`);
        }
        
        this.svg.style.display = 'block';
      }
    }
  }

  // Initialize
  new FlowConnector('.flowchart-container', 'flow-svg');
</script>
```

::: {.package-card .box #core-card}

##### [DynamicPPL.jl <i class="bi bi-box-arrow-up-right" style="font-size: 0.4em;"></i>](https://turinglang.org/DynamicPPL.jl/){.panel-title}

<p>A domain-specific language and backend for probabilistic programming languages, used by [Turing.jl.](https://github.com/TuringLang/Turing.jl)</p>

:::

::: {.package-card .box #core-card}

##### [JuliaBUGS.jl <i class="bi bi-box-arrow-up-right" style="font-size: 0.4em;"></i>](https://turinglang.org/JuliaBUGS.jl/){.panel-title}

<p>A modern implementation of the [BUGS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayesian_inference_using_Gibbs_sampling) probabilistic programming language in Julia.</p>

:::

::: {.package-card .box #core-card}

##### [TuringGLM.jl <i class="bi bi-box-arrow-up-right" style="font-size: 0.4em;"></i>](https://turinglang.org/TuringGLM.jl/){.panel-title}

<p>Bayesian Generalized Linear models using [`@formula`](https://turinglang.org/TuringGLM.jl/stable/#@formula) syntax and returns an instantiated [Turing](https://github.com/TuringLang/Turing.jl) model.</p>

:::


::: {.package-card .box #core-card}

##### [AdvancedHMC.jl <i class="bi bi-box-arrow-up-right" style="font-size: 0.4em;"></i>](https://turinglang.org/AdvancedHMC.jl/){.panel-title}

<p>A robust, modular and efficient implementation of advanced HMC algorithms. ([abs](https://proceedings.mlr.press/v118/xu20a.html), [pdf](https://proceedings.mlr.press/v118/xu20a/xu20a.pdf))</p>

:::
